0.name: Governor's School for Government and International Studioes
0.summary: Ranked 13th nationally in 2013 by Newsweek and 10th by The Daily Best in 2014, Governor's School was were I was first introduced to computer programming and web development.

1.name: Virginia Tech
1.summary: Focusing on C++ and computer science theory, I began my college education at Virgina Tech. Here I developed a strong base of object oriented programming and the theory driving most of computer science.

2.name: Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU)
2.description: Bachelor's of Engineering in Computer Science
2.summary: After being offered an opportunity to convert a summer internship into a fulltime position in 2001, I transferred to VCU to continue my education.  Coding heavily in Java, I learned the importance of modular code and took courses focusing on artificial intelligence, parallel programming, and software design.

3.name: Johns Hopkins University
3.summary: Covering everything from getting and cleaning the data, analyzing the data, and making sure research was reproducable, these courses taught R and the ideas and procedures used to analyze sets of data. I achieved “100% with Distinction” grade from every course.

4.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
4.description: Fundamentals of Computational Thinking and Data Science
4.summary: This course allowed me to reinforce my theoretical base in computer science. Utilizing Python, I worked to create many different theoretical models and enhanced the performance of Monte Carlo simulations and stochastic models.

0.name: McKesson
0.title: Fulltime - Senior Web Developer
0.summary: As a senior at The Secret Lab I work on projects like Kaartjes.nl, Clay.com and more. Using frameworks and technologies such as Laravel, Wordpress, Drupal 8 and ElasticSearch. I also introduced working with Git Flow and supporting my colleagues to write nice readable and reusable code.

1.name: ASCAP
1.title: Fulltime - Creative Developer
1.summary: Caviar Digital is a digital agency based in Amsterdam. I worked here as a creative developer on a big project for the new Samsung Galaxy S6 / S6 edge and created a configurable CMS based on the Laravel Framework. Due to economically reasons it was a short but good experience.

2.name: Jefferies
2.title: Fulltime - Lead Developer
2.summary: Whoopaa is a startup that began as a social network where users were able to separate their business- and personal social life. As this idea didn't exactly take off the way we expected it to, we changed the idea. We began a job matching platform, where Whoopaa became the place for job seekers to make an interactive CV enriched with certified tests. The place where companies can create job openings and efficiently find the right candidates needed a name as well, and was called HRMatches. I developed an own framework, which I improved in user experience and speed after the big idea change. I also developed the real time match algorithm as well as a lot of other helpful algorithms.
2.location: New York, NY, Jersey City, NJ & Red Bank, NJ
